snippet: A federal judge dismissed the Department of Education’s requirement that, for career-training schools to get federal aid, at least 35 percent of graduates must be repaying their student loans.
abstract: Federal Judge Rudolph Contreras overturns a main component of the 'gainful employment' rules introduced by the federal Department of Education in 2011; regulations were devised to prevent for-profit colleges, which get the bulk of their revenues from federal student aid, from leaving students with huge debt loads and credentials that provided little help in landing them a job.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge dismissed the Department of Education’s requirement that, for career-training schools to get federal aid, at least 35 percent of graduates must be repaying their student loans.

headline.seo: Judge Strikes a For-Profit College Regulation
headline.main: Judge Strikes Main Element of For-Profit College Rules
headline.print_headline: Judge Strikes Main Element Of For-Profit College Rules
